meanings.definition: The process of becoming hard or solid.
meanings.sent1: The induration of the clay made it difficult to mold.
meanings.sent2: The induration of the ice made it slippery to walk on.
meanings.sent3: The induration of the cake batter made it impossible to pour into the pan.
meanings.sent4: The induration of his heart prevented him from feeling any compassion.
meanings.sent5: The induration of the rock face was a testament to the power of time and pressure.

meanings.definition: A hardening of tissue, especially in response to inflammation or infection.
meanings.sent1: The doctor observed induration around the wound, indicating an infection.
meanings.sent2: The induration of the skin was a sign of a serious underlying condition.
meanings.sent3: The induration of the cheese left in the fridge for too long was quite a surprise.
meanings.sent4: The induration of her resolve to succeed was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The induration of the tree bark protected it from the harsh elements.
